abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Development Policy Loan
            (DPL) with a Deferred Drawdown Option (DDO) Project for
            Romania were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was moderate, Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            in retrospect, the choice of the DDO instrument was
            appropriate; the Bank should consider to promote it more
            actively to clients who seek risk insurance to adverse
            exogenous shocks rather than direct financing. Relevant
            analytical work and synergy with other Bank activities are
            essential. The DPL-DDO design was built on a solid
            foundation of country knowledge acquired through thorough
            analytical work. Just-in-time policy advice and technical
            assistance make a difference. Political leadership and
            direct involvement of senior officials (often the Prime
            Minister) is critical to implement sensitive reforms.
            Baseline indicators and targets (for example, savings from
            elimination of certain drugs from the list of compensated
            medicine) must be firmly documented, or when revised must be
            reflected in amended targets. Definition of results
            indicators must be consistent over the lifetime of the
            operation, or appropriate corrections in targets must be
            made when revised.
